deleted_lines: if conf.enable_metadata_network: # check if the network has a metadata subnet meta_cidr = netaddr.IPNetwork(METADATA_DEFAULT_CIDR) if any(netaddr.IPNetwork(s.cidr) in meta_cidr for s in all_subnets): return True

devstack: rename local NEXUSPATH to _NEXUSPATH

in order to avoid confusion local NEXUSPATH with global NEXUSPATH,
rename local NEXUSPATH to _NEXUSPATH.

commit_message:
Support az filter for snapshot

Sometimes if users want to create volumes from snapshots
with a specified availability_zone, users may want to know
what snapshots are available. In this case, users always
want to filter the snapshots with "availability_zone" first.

This patch added the availability_zone filter for snapshot list.

Change-Id: I8953eca5f535c1399dc882c4a232fbeef9bb2959

subject: Fix "with-items" locking
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-07 12:15:11.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/engine/tasks.py', 'mistral/engine/task_handler.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/mistral/commit/7c9c7459ff54702bec88bf4ce74380974ca64b62', 'message': 'Fix "with-items" locking

* Previously we thought that we can avoid locking task execution
  when we process completion of an individual action inside
  WithItemsTask. But that was wrong because even when we don't
  need to control "concurrency" property we still can get a
  situation when two different action completions will be
  processed via scheduler and both will see all actions in state
  SUCCESS (because scheduler handles it in a different later
  transaction) and hence both will complete the task and run
  tasks from "on-xxx" clauses. This patch makes WithItemsTask
  always use locking.
* Added db_utils.retry_on_deadlock for
  _scheduled_on_action_complete() method since it opens a new
  DB transaction and can potentially end up in a dead lock (due
  to MySQL nature)

Closes-Bug: #1715116

Change-Id: I6f34409e7182af3ca5b13c17e6d6fb4302f9efed
(cherry picked from commit 7b45a50a42f88f137ea6fa72959f3731bff2974c)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix "with-items" locking

* Previously we thought that we can avoid locking task execution
  when we process completion of an individual action inside
  WithItemsTask. But that was wrong because even when we don't
  need to control "concurrency" property we still can get a
  situation when two different action completions will be
  processed via scheduler and both will see all actions in state
  SUCCESS (because scheduler handles it in a different later
  transaction) and hence both will complete the task and run
  tasks from "on-xxx" clauses. This patch makes WithItemsTask
  always use locking.
* Added db_utils.retry_on_deadlock for
  _scheduled_on_action_complete() method since it opens a new
  DB transaction and can potentially end up in a dead lock (due
  to MySQL nature)

Closes-Bug: #1715116

Change-Id: I6f34409e7182af3ca5b13c17e6d6fb4302f9efed
(cherry picked from commit 7b45a50a42f88f137ea6fa72959f3731bff2974c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/08/501708/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from mistral.db import utils as db_utils@db_utils.retry_on_deadlock

commit_message:
[RFC] Remove 'build' from Makefile

Using helm to build (helm package) seems to not always work.  Gate and
other scripts have updated to not needing the helm server but rather
referencing the chart directories directly.  Remove the unneeded build
logic.

Change-Id: Ifb73fc7ddd76c6e460d8b8fef77bd2b83385d5b2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm refs/changes/43/502143/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: HELM := helm TASK := build @make $(TASK)-$@ if [ -d $* ]; then $(HELM) lint $*; fi build-%: lint-% if [ -d $* ]; then $(HELM) package $*; fi

test_ha_router: wait until two agents are scheduled

We need to give some time to neutron-server to schedule the router to
both agents. This reflects what other fullstack test cases do.

commit_message:
Allow setting up multiple cells in the base TestCase

This lays the groundwork for other tests to get multiple
cells setup in the base TestCase by overriding a variable.

Change-Id: Ic27369dd3711e5b6bf11c98f742b5dc20a3a2799
Related-Bug: #1715493

commit_message:
update static urls for pike

A number of places in our docs have static links to ocata based content.
What's more some of our doc content lives at a new URL.

This patch updates our docs to ref pike rather than ocata.

This patch should be backported to pike.

Change-Id: Ieefaf7a78dce03faf9df1ca7d596bbd81230805b
Closes-Bug: #1714516

commit_message:
Fix test_rpc_consumer_isolation for oslo.messaging 5.31.0

With this change in oslo.messaging 5.31.0:

  I0bbf9fca0ecbe71efa87c9613ffd32eb718f2c0e

the endpoint passed in is going to be checked for a 'target'
attribute and check its type if set, so looking for it has
to be ignored.

Change-Id: Ib268d48f1b4affd979d7542f41af07f48141addc
Closes-Bug: #1715470
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/73/502173/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def __getattribute__(self, name): if name == 'target': # oslo.messaging 5.31.0 explicitly looks for 'target' # on the endpoint and checks its type, so we can't avoid # it here. Just ignore it if that's the case. return assert False, "I should never get called - name: %s" % name
deleted_lines: def __getattribute__(*args): assert False, "I should never get called."

commit_message:
WIP: Nova: Update bootstrap Mechanism

This PS Updates the Nova Bootstrap Mechansim to make it more
flexible and support complex arbitary actions.

Partially implements: blueprint service-bootstrap

See: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/openstack-helm/+spec/service-bootstrap

Change-Id: Ib4da3ee5fa2c8d81c79ddb195f70b8b8f6b9361d

commit_message:
Horizon: Update docker image to workaround kolla bug

This PS update the docker image to one that is able to display
the heat topology view - which current kolla images cannot
display due to a bug in the upstream project.

Change-Id: I62c3703f29ea3a0c14265f1274cfafbec6d54753

commit_message:
teach yaml-validate.py how to be --quiet

This adds the --quiet (-q) option to yaml-validate.py.  With '-q',
yaml-validate.py will only print warnings or errors. With '-qq',
yaml-validate.py will print only errors. This makes it much easier to
spot problems when working on templates.

This commit does not change the default behavior of yaml-validate.py.

Change-Id: I358f1d4edde03714627d98361b44e6b90ce5e93c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/54/501454/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import argparse if args.quiet < 1: print('Validating %s' % filename) if not in_resources and not in_outputs and args.quiet < 2:def parse_args(): p = argparse.ArgumentParser() p.add_argument('--quiet', '-q', action='count', help='output warnings and errors (-q) or only errors (-qq)') p.add_argument('path_args', nargs='*', default=['.']) return p.parse_args() args = parse_args() path_args = args.path_args quiet = args.quiet elif args.quiet < 1:
deleted_lines: print('Validating %s' % filename) if not in_resources and not in_outputs:if len(sys.argv) < 2: exit_usage() path_args = sys.argv[1:] else:

AND the plan environment is missing in Mistral, the upgrade will fail.

commit_message:
Protect against plan migration failing

If both plan-environment.yaml is missing in a plan's Swift container
AND the plan environment is missing in Mistral, the upgrade will fail.
This should never happen in the real world, but could still happen in
case of testing plans being created without necessary files.

Change-Id: I88ee4cd0f54c84aa22d911925e95fe878d3fc6bc
Closes-bug: #1712738
(cherry picked from commit 29aaed374358f78d0ae0d333e56560ed51cf1c3d)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud refs/changes/82/501982/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from mistralclient.api import base as mistralclient_base try: env = mistral.environments.get(plan).variables except (mistralclient_base.APIException, ks_exceptions.http.NotFound): LOG.warning('Could not find plan "%s" environment in Mistral ' '- nothing to migrate.' % plan) else: yaml_string = yaml.safe_dump(env, default_flow_style=False) swift.put_object(plan, plan_env_filename, yaml_string) mistral.environments.delete(plan)
deleted_lines: env = mistral.environments.get(plan).variables yaml_string = yaml.safe_dump(env, default_flow_style=False) swift.put_object(plan, plan_env_filename, yaml_string) mistral.environments.delete(plan)

added_lines: * Retype a replicated volume. * Create, delete, update, snapshot, and clone generic volume groups. * Create and delete generic volume group snapshots. * Create a generic volume group from a group snapshot or another group. * Volume Compression.* ``hpe3par:compression`` For ``hpe3par:compression`` key, the HPE 3PAR StoreServ Storage array must meet the following requirements: * Firmware version HPE 3PAR OS 3.3.1 * HPE 3PAR Storage system with 8k or 20k series * Compression license installed * Supported only on Solid State drives * The assigned CPG for a compressed volume must be set to device type of "SSD" Other restrictions and considerations for ``hpe3par:compression``: - For a compressed volume, minimum volume size needed is 16 GB; otherwise resulting volume will be created successfully but will not be a compressed volume. - A full provisioned volume cannot be compressed, if a compression is enabled and provisioning type requested is full, the resulting volume defaults to thinly provisioned compressed volume.
deleted_lines: * Create, delete, update, snapshot, and clone consistency groups. * Create and delete consistency group snapshots. * Create a consistency group from a consistency group snapshot or another group.

commit_message:
Tempest: Fix cleaning of subnets

Similar to I52428262276c16dbe077fcf77b1890f12dccc97d,
any subnets created with another client were failing to delete
with an HTTPNotFound which was silently ignored. So
we were implicitly depending on deletion of the network to
actually cleanup the subnet.

This adjusts the logic to use the admin_client to delete the subnet
whenever a different client is used.

Change-Id: Ie7d733a501b87fd2334054e72c86b8dae36da37c
(cherry picked from commit 5feac7d8b00ebfe7e665b070aa3eca07876242db)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/19/501219/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Pecan: add missing body to delete notify payload

The legacy API controller included the original object in the delete
notification body payload. This adjusts pecan to do the same.

Closes-Bug: #1714386
Change-Id: I5b2f87e7b1eccceedb821506bb2de43b764fde8d
(cherry picked from commit 1d3c404d7305d0e5dc61c85476fdebb6df8e88f7)

commit_message:
Pecan: process filters at end of hook pipeline

Separate user-applied filters from policy-enforcement
filters processing and put it at the end of the pipeline
so users can't put filters on the API request that impact
the fields available to the hooks.

This prevents a filter excluding the ID field from breaking
pagination.

Change-Id: I05f4582fb1e8809740d473e24fa54483e040a6c8
Closes-Bug: #1714131
(cherry picked from commit 41e6f02bf253e82fcc4baf4b77795ad831b58b43)

commit_message:
Pecan: set tenant_id field when project_id set

Add logic to pecan to add 'project_id' as a mandatory policy
field whenever 'tenant_id' is specified as a policy field.
This logic was added to the previous controller code to ensure
that 'project_id' was queried in the database whenever 'tenant_id'
was required by the policy engine and the user had fields set.

Closes-Bug: #1714378
Change-Id: I3652fbc50ce0c9a7cd1cc193e0933cf0373ecb54
(cherry picked from commit bf36f8c934b49310103a1b1831c9f7c8a0d14adf)

commit_message:
Document dns_domain for ports attribute

This commit adds to the Networking Guide chapter for DNS integration the
workings of the dns_domain attribute for ports.

Change-Id: Ib775fe3d44b766c457875a04460ad90d1e377974
Closes-Bug: #1710203
(cherry picked from commit d5b4f242d4242206be7c7efc0cda1842b6d04c0b)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/49/501649/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

This preserves backwards API compatibility. 2. commit_message:
Fix cleaning QoS rules for not existing port.

If port update event is received by L2 agent and there is
no QoS policy assigned to such port, agent tries to delete
any existing QoS rules from port.
For bandwidth limit rules OVS qos driver tries to update
port in OVS database.
In case if port not exists in OVS database agent raised
exception.

This patch fixes that by checking if port really exists and
removing QoS bandwidth limit rules only for existing ports.

Change-Id: I3775ee7b383ada6e4e4ace53b5405aa3c7c22027
Closes-Bug: 1712913
(cherry picked from commit 46289c3c74bfa6ce258067026b54fa9887e3a942)

commit_message:
Migrate machine tests related to state transitions

Migrating the machine tests where state transitions
occur, such as turning power on/off, maintenance mode,
hardware inspection, and general provision state changes
such as activating a node and deactivating a node.

Change-Id: I88663fecb79247d5473c47847f9c7405f447a80d

commit_message:
keystone: pass region name to keystone client

If multiple Keystone are registered into the catalog and Keystone API is used
(e.g. gnocchi dispatcher uses it to find the project id), then the region is
picked randomly by Keystone client to choose the Keystone server.

Change-Id: Ia6ae72994431bfcf31c10866c7079784487411c1
(cherry picked from commit 89ef6422f150637cff0830cb88ec0b99ac00e49b)

commit_message:
keystone: pass region name to keystone client

If multiple Keystone are registered into the catalog and Keystone API is used
(e.g. gnocchi dispatcher uses it to find the project id), then the region is
picked randomly by Keystone client to choose the Keystone server.

Change-Id: Ia6ae72994431bfcf31c10866c7079784487411c1
(cherry picked from commit 89ef6422f150637cff0830cb88ec0b99ac00e49b)

deleted_lines: def get_client(conf, trust_id=None, requests_session=None, group=None): return ks_client_v3.Client(session=session, trust_id=trust_id)

commit_message:
Add release note for RabbitMQ ulimit

The release note didn't make it in with the RabbitMQ ulimit
adjustment patch. This patch adds the note.

Closes-Bug: 1714511
Change-Id: I858f459fad829571c66f3baac4432c3d0318820d
(cherry picked from commit b5daa6b3c12493d463261b454d8e5a69b82a1cf5)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-rabbitmq_server refs/changes/61/501461/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | The default ulimit for RabbitMQ is now 65536. Deployers can still adjust this limit using the ``rabbitmq_ulimit`` Ansible variable.

commit_message:
Consume validate_host parameters from site-variables

The settings are in the site-variables.yaml file, we don't need to
provide them in the job anymore.

Also, move validate-host earlier so that we collect the generated
inventory file and check network connectivity before we attempt to push
git repos over the wire.

Depends-On: I632a32fdfac4bfe57eb269ac8e183fb8df34d48f
Change-Id: I1131eb47f836f8c86b7e9e6329199612243873aa

commit_message:
Fix an issue that the gate wrongly passed

In before, the gate passed with failed tests. This is because
we captured the wrong exit code. The exit code should be captured
right after the execution of the tests.

Change-Id: Ic707ec611f841d7988728e973d56525dc2282881
(cherry picked from commit a71d831832368c5040dfca4062935125c9b0b0c6)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zun refs/changes/84/499884/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: EXIT_CODE=$?

commit_message:
Change where the modify script logs

Right now it logs on something like
/var/lib/oooq-images/repo_setup.sh.log this changes so that it can
save that log on the {{working_dir}} to be more accessible

Change-Id: Ifa7d6eb43ea86e97ef5707d378901d3e2c074a7a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/70/499070/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: > {{ working_dir }}/{{ modify_script|default('modify_image')|replace('/','_') }}.log 2>&1

commit_message:
Revert "Revert "Revert "Set OVH max-servers to 0"""

This reverts commit 9d6d809f87dfd35ba6bfb15ffc9b461a7c48f4cf.

OVH is now working again. Theory is the tight loop of boot/delete caused
ovh to be unhappy. Now that images are working again we should run at
much less of full throttle.

Change-Id: I1cba7b86f00cba9c7789bd286041047faed31e26
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/40/502140/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: max-servers: 79 max-servers: 159
